db.iface

Interface ComponentConfigurationController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OrientDBComponentConfigurationController

    public interface ComponentConfigurationController
    Used to hold all the configuration and persistent data of a single component (control interface or module).
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

      • getChildElements

        java.util.Set<DataElement> getChildElements(java.lang.String domain,
                                            java.lang.String[] path)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            DatabaseException
        Gets all child Elements of a parent element. IMPORTANT: Regarding the returned value, NULL is not the same as an empty Set! Example: An element with type FILE could have no children Set and would therefore return NULL, but a FOLDER type element could have an empty children Set that represents an empty folder. It is NOT up to the database to enforce that!
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        path - the path
        Returns:
        A Set of child elements or NULL if no such parent element or if parent element does not contain children Set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the illegal argument exception
        DatabaseException - the database exception

      • isElementMarked

        boolean isElementMarked(java.lang.String domain,
                        java.lang.String[] path)
                 throws DatabaseException
        Checks if Element is currently marked.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        path - the path
        Returns:
        True if marked, false if not marked or nonexistent.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - the database exception

      • moveElement

        boolean moveElement(java.lang.String srcDomain,
                    java.lang.String[] srcPath,
                    java.lang.String destDomain,
                    java.lang.String[] destPath)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    DatabaseException
        Moves Element from source domain/path to destination. Can also be used to rename Element. MUST NOT overwrite existing Elements.
        Parameters:
        srcDomain - the src domain
        srcPath - the src path
        destDomain - the dest domain
        destPath - the dest path
        Returns:
        True if successfully moved/renamed, false if nonexistent of destination Element exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the illegal argument exception
        DatabaseException - the database exception

        boolean unmarkAllElements(java.lang.String domain)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          DatabaseException
        Unmark all elements.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        Returns:
        true if updated successfully, false if Element does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the illegal argument exception
        DatabaseException - the database exception

      • updateElementProperties

        boolean updateElementProperties(java.lang.String domain,
                                java.lang.String[] path,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                DatabaseException
        Updates Element's properties in database, merges/overwrites existing properties.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        path - the path
        properties - NULL keys or values are NOT allowed, but values may be empty (-> "")
        Returns:
        true if updated successfully, false if Element does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - or if properties contains NULL keys or values.
        DatabaseException - the database exception

      • updateElementProperty

        boolean updateElementProperty(java.lang.String domain,
                              java.lang.String[] path,
                              java.lang.String propertyKey,
                              java.lang.String propertyValue)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              DatabaseException
        Updates Element's property in database, overwrites existing property. NULL for key or value is NOT allowed.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain
        path - the path
        propertyKey - the property key
        propertyValue - may be empty (-> "")
        Returns:
        true if updated successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - or if key or value contains NULL.
        DatabaseException - the database exception
